conversation.content: I received a gift card for my birthday last week. The balance is showing as zero even though it should have fifty dollars.
I understand your concern and I'll help you resolve this immediately. May I have the gift card number located on the back of the card, starting with GC?
The number is GC-4829-7361-9042. I haven't used it at all.
Thank you. I'm pulling up gift card GC-4829-7361-9042 in our system now. I can see it was activated on October 12th with a fifty dollar balance as you mentioned.
That's correct. So where did the balance go?
I see what happened here. There was a transaction on October 14th at 3:47 PM Eastern for exactly fifty dollars at one of our online checkout systems.
That wasn't me. I haven't even tried to use the card yet.
I understand completely. Let me check the transaction details including the order number ORD-9847-ZM and the IP address 192.168.45.227 that was used for this purchase.
Could someone have used my card number without my knowledge?
That's a possibility I'm investigating. The transaction shows delivery to an address in ZIP code 44107, which is Cleveland, Ohio. Does this location sound familiar to you?
No, I live in Phoenix. This is definitely fraudulent.
Thank you for confirming. I'm immediately flagging this transaction as unauthorized and initiating case number FRD-2024-10-8847 for our fraud prevention team to investigate further.
What happens now? Will I get my fifty dollars back?
Absolutely. I'm processing a full refund right now and issuing you a replacement gift card with number GC-4829-7361-9043, which will have the full fifty dollar value restored.
How long will this take? I was planning to use it this weekend.
Of course. The new gift card will be active within the next two hours, and you'll receive an email confirmation to the address on file ending in @gmail.com with all the details.
That works. Should I destroy the compromised gift card?
Yes, please destroy the physical card. I've already deactivated gift card GC-4829-7361-9042 in our system at 10:34 AM today, so it cannot be used again.
Perfect. Is there anything else you need from me for the investigation?
Everything is handled on our end. Your case FRD-2024-10-8847 will be reviewed by our security team, and if we need additional information, we'll contact you at the phone number ending in 7723.
